intro: Palicourea chiapensis, commonly known as Chiapan palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central America, particularly found in the Mexican states of Chiapas and Oaxaca. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
